column4: I am removing the GTKpod and re-installing it maybe as i connected it to the wrong/old iPod not the iPod touch
remove doesnt remove config
per-user configs like that would be in your home directory
i dont know what to do with config
if it has its own directory like ~/.gtkpod then delete it
otherwise, might need to run gconf-editor and dig through there to find its settings and remove them
yes i am going to delet the .gtkpod folder too
i have deleted the .gtkpod folder too
ffmpeg is hte usual for video & audio file conversions
sudo mount -o loop -t iso9660 /path/to/your.iso  /mnt
no, no gui. there should be. hrmph. i should take that as a papercut next release cycle
the thing i said will work
what is -t there?
it tells it the filesystem type. iso9660 is what cds are.  it shouldnt be necessary to include that bit, but it also won't hurt anything
i used sudo mount -o loop -t iso9660 /path/to/your.iso  /mnt but its just giving me details about commands
did you change /path/to/your.iso to actually be the path to your iso?
Desktop is the folder. you need the actual iso

wine?
